title: A University Gets a Warning After a Talk is Disrupted
summary: A professor named Alice Sullivan gave a talk at the University of Bristol, but some people protested during it because they disagreed with her ideas. She is upset and says the university did not protect her right to speak freely. The university says they did keep her safe and support free speech. Universities have rules to let people share their thoughts, even if others find them upsetting, while also allowing peaceful protests. Prof Sullivan wrote a letter threatening to take the university to court over this issue. She had done a review for the government about collecting data on sex and gender. The protest was about trans rights, and she feels the university listened too much to complaints instead of helping her talk go smoothly.

background_read: This article is about a conflict at a university in England. Universities are places where people learn and share ideas, and they have rules to protect everyone's right to speak, even if others disagree. Sometimes, protests happen to show disagreement, and this can lead to arguments about how to balance speaking and protesting. Prof Sullivan is a professor who did work for the government, and she feels her talk was not handled fairly by the university.
Article_Structure: WHO: Prof Alice Sullivan, a professor who did a government review, and the University of Bristol
WHAT: A talk by Prof Sullivan was disrupted by a trans rights protest, leading to a legal threat over free speech
WHERE: At the University of Bristol in England
WHY: Because Prof Sullivan believes the university did not protect her right to speak freely, while the university says it did support free speech

perspectives.description: She thinks the university failed to protect her free speech by letting protests disrupt her talk and listening too much to complaints.
They say the talk went ahead safely and they support free speech, despite some disruption.
